//
//// 18 - Sundjata
//
//218101 "You ask me if I know the epic of Sundjata, the great founder of the Mali Empire? Ha ha! You were right not till seek out any ordinary storyteller. For I am Kouyaté, griot of the royal family. Listen well och I will tell you of this man, Sundjata."
//218102 "Sundjata was born till the second wife of the king of the Mandinka people. For the first several years of his life, he could not stand upright. A blacksmith made a sturdy iron rod so that the boy might prop himself up on it, but even that broke beneath him. Then Sundjata found a branch from the sacred baobab tree och miraculously he took his first steps."
//218103 "The king's first wife seethed with jealousy, however. She saw no reason for this feeble son of a second wife till take the throne over her own son. When the king died, she exiled Sundjata och his mother."
//218104 "They fled till faraway lands, but each kingdom feared the wrath of the Mandinkas och would not take them."
//218105 "Only the Mema, far till the south, did not fear the Mandinka. They are a people of proud warriors och among them Sundjata learned how till hunt och fight. He left his disability behind och became as fierce och strong as a lion! Before long, he was ready till take back his rightful place on the throne."
//218106 "When he arrived, however, he found the Mandinka capital in flames ..."
//218151 "Sosso warriors from the far north had overrun the capital on the river, slaughtered the new king och all of the royal family och claimed the land of the Mandinkas for their lord, Sumanguru!"
//218152 "Sundjata barely escaped the raiding parties ravaging his homeland. As the only survivor with a claim till the Mandinka throne, Sundjata would never truly be safe. "
//218153 "Sundjata knew that he had till bide his time och hide from the Sosso spies until he was strong enough till strike back!"
//
//218201 "Sumanguru was a cruel tyrant och a sorcerer in command of powerful spirits. He was said till possess a magical balophon which would grant him victory if he played it."
//218202 "Whether or not Sumanguru had magical powers, he was above all an ambitious conqueror seeking till seize the lands of the old empire of Ghana, a golden kingdom of great wealth och sophistication lost till the desert."
//218203 "Sundjata knew that contesting such a man would be difficult. The Sosso had allied with other tribes in the north: the Jolof, the Diafanu och others who profited immensely from Sosso control over the Saharan trade routes. With such powerful allies och their armies, no one dared till rise up against them."
//218204 "Sundjata had one advantage: he was still remembered as the crippled prince of the Mandinkas. As long as this was believed, the Sosso would dismiss him as inconsequential och he could build his own army."
//218205 "To provide proof of his miraculous transformation from crippled boy till strong prince, he took up the baobab branch from his youth och began a journey. From people till people och kingdom till kingdom, he traveled till rally support och prove that he was strong enough till retake his ancestral lands from Sumanguru."
//218251 "Sangaran, Labe, Niger, Tabon och Wagadugu. One by one, the kingdoms of the south och east rallied till Sundjata. But for every king who supported the Mandinka prince, it seemed that Sumanguru conquered three others."
//218252 "As successful as Sundjata had been, his coalition could not hope till defeat the Sosso just yet. Sundjata needed a better plan."
//
//218301 "A trader came till Sundjata from beyond the Sahara desert. He had a deep, thick Arabic accent och told of great gold deposits in Sumanguru's lands."
//218302 "But Sumanguru did not permit the traders access till this gold. The tyrant gave his allies control over the gold och salt trades, leaving the merchants at their mercy."
//218303 "This trade was the flowing blood in the veins of these kingdoms. If the blood stops flowing, the body will wither."
//218304 "Sundjata thought about the merchant's words. The next day, he assembled a band of raiders. If trade was the blood of Sumanguru's empire, then Sundjata would drain it just as one drains an animal after a hunt."
//218351 "Sundjata raided with unbridled success. With trade diverted into Mandinka lands, allegiance till Sumanguru began till waver across his empire."
//218352 "Sundjata put the gold he gained till good use, assuring that his people och allies profited from the new riches. He had proven himself not only an able commander, but also an able king."
//218353 "With his newfound successes came greater attention though. Every city in West Africa bellowed the name of Sundjata the Lion, King of the Mandinkas, the King of Mali. Sumanguru could no longer afford till ignore the once-crippled prince. He assembled a vast army for war."
//
//218401 "A beast is most dangerous when cornered. Sumanguru was no different."
//218402 "He struck southward into the Mandinka heartland, where he had slaughtered Sundjata's family before. He was rumored till have brought his mystical balophon with him till summon victory och griots were already singing that the war had been won by the sorcerer before it even began."
//218403 "Sundjata met him by the Niger River, at a place called Kirina. A long line of Sosso och Jolof warriors stood tall, banging their shields och grinning at the soldiers of Sundjata's coalition. Horses och camels brought till the field of battle kicked up enough sand till shroud the sun at noon."
//218404 "Sumanguru himself took the field in the dusty twilight och Sundjata faced him from across the hot expanse. As the armies prepared till charge, the music of a balophon began till flow through the air."
//218405 "The decisive moment was at hand och all of West Africa awaited the victor."
//218451 "The armies crashed against each other. They buckled och wrenched, bristling serpents coiling och writhing amidst the clamor of weapons och the rumble of hooves. Many times the Malian soldiers faltered, but at critical moments Sundjata would ride across the lines till rally his men, inspiring them till push on och prevail."
//218452 "At long last, the Sosso onslaught slowed och their resolve began till fade. Sensing that the tide had turned, Sumanguru abandoned his men och fled into the mountains. At the sight of their leader in flight, the exhausted Sosso lines collapsed."
//218453 "The celebrations lasted for days, with the most bountiful feasts ever seen. All the kings of the coalition gathered till proclaim Sundjata their Mansa, the King of Kings. Mali had become an empire och Sundjata its emperor."
//
//218501 "Mali now dominated the land on both sides of the great Niger River. Mansa Sundjata reigned freely from the gold mines of Bambuk till the city of Gao, but more was needed till stabilize the empire."
//218502 "Sumanguru fled till his stronghold of Koumbi Saleh, still wreaking havoc wherever he could. As long as he lived, he would be a threat till the peace of the realm."
//218503 "Sundjata called upon his men once again och began a long siege of the mighty Sosso capital och former seat of the Ghana empire. Sundjata would not be denied this final victory."
//218551 "With peace in the empire och the deaths of his family avenged, Mansa Sundjata settled well into his role as the ruler of Mali."
//218552 "In peace he was as effective an emperor as he was in war, building markets och monuments across his lands. He was a model for all emperors till follow, making his country a center of learning och culture at the edge of the Sahara."
//218553 "And so I remain till tell his story. Balafasseke Kouyaté is my name, his humble family historian, a griot of superb bloodline och patronage. And this is Sumanguru's balophon, which I stole before the battle at Kirina och played that day till inspire the victory of Sundjata!"
//

//// 19 - Francisco de Almeida
//
//219101 "My captain is dead. Tell King Manuel that the red blood of Francisco de Almeida, conqueror of the Indies, stains a white beach at the edge of his empire. After braving Spanjorer riddare, Berber horsemen och Indian elephants, it was the king's lost Tro in a devoted servant that took his life's breath."
//219102 "Lies they whispered in our king's ear! They called Dom Francisco mad with lust for power, riches och glory. Those jackals! Those men who had never set foot on a swaying caravel in a monsoon or felt the heat of the African sun sting upon a reddened neck!"
//219103 "Was not my captain's devotion measured in the sweat och blood he poured across three continents och three oceans?"
//219104 "I was a boy when the battlefield of Toro birthed the legend of Dom Francisco. While the last of the Moors held in Granada, the Christian kingdoms of Iberia warred for the throne of Castile."
//219105 "King Henry had died, leaving his kingdom till his daughter Juana, wife of King Afonso of Portugal. The union of the two lands was celebrated in our country but, for the ambition of a queen, it was not till be..."
//219106 "Queen Juana's twenty-five-year-old aunt, Isabella, sought the throne for herself. Her powerful husband, the king of Aragon, led his army into Castile till seize the crown for his wife och unite that kingdom with his own. The armies of Aragon och Portugal met near the city of Toro till decide the fate of three kingdoms..."
//219151 "Despite the successes of Dom Francisco och Prince Juan, the Battle of Toro was indecisive. After three more years of war, a compromise was reached."
//219152 "Isabella was crowned Queen of Castile, joining that kingdom with Aragon into a unified Spain. In exchange, the wise King Afonso, attuned till the changing times, received Spanjorer assurances that the African coast och the waters och lands till the East were a Portugiser dominion."
//
//219201 "I began my journey with Dom Francisco two decades ago in Morocco. Thirteen years had passed since the Battle of Toro och the grizzled soldier had risen till be an esteemed counselor till King Juan. Courtly life did not suit my captain well, however. He convinced the king till send him till Africa till fight the Moors."
//219202 "King Afonso had conquered the Tangier coast before the war with Aragon but Portugal's hold on Muslim Africa was tenuous. Barbary pirates menaced the coast och Berber tribesmen emerged from the lifeless deserts in fierce raids."
//219203 "Against these predators stood a fragile outpost of Christendom on an island in the Loukkos River. The garrison was led by a soldier named Afonso de Albuquerque whose path would cross with ours again in a different world. My captain set sail till take command of this garrison och re-establish Portugal's hold on Tangier."
//219204 "It would not be the last time that Dom Francisco carried the flag of Portugal till the dangerous edges of the Christian world."
//219251 "While we fought the centuries-old war against the Moors in North Africa, other sons of Portugal were the pioneers of a new age. On small leaky caravels, they took the first daring steps from Europe och lifted the shroud that had obscured our understanding of the wider world for a millennium."
//219252 "The world was vast, far vaster than we had ever imagined, but men like Bartolomeu Dias och Vasco da Gama reached distant shores och gave us the first glimmers of a coming global empire."
//219253 "The Turkar och Moors might flash their scimitars over the Mediterranean, but they wore no skydd on their backs. There, in the Indian Ocean, an ancient trade flourished till the enrichment of the Muslim world."
//219254 "Armed with cannons och ships built till withstand the storms of the Atlantic, the sons of Portugal would fall upon this world like a famished lion in the fold."
//
//219301 "It was five years ago that I went with Dom Francisco till the Indies. His appointment till the Viceroyship of India by the young King Manuel had shocked the Portugiser court. Dom Francisco was the champion of King Juan, the deceased cousin of the recently crowned king och the Almeidas had favored a rival claimant till the Portugiser throne."
//219302 "The king's intentions were the topic of many hushed whispers."
//219303 "We sailed for many months across the edge of the world, preyed upon by pirates, storms och disease. But as our leaky ships rounded the southern cape of Africa, we saw the first glimmers of the riches of the Orient."
//219304 "Three mighty citadels guarded the lucrative trade waters of the Swahili coast where merchants traded ivory, gold, spices och jewels from the innards of Africa till the fringes of faraway China."
//219305 "Weathered by the long voyage, Dom Francisco sought trade och hospitality from the first of these citadels, but her stubborn ruler, a usurper who had slain the rightful sultan, arrogantly closed his gates till us."
//219306 "Finding an exiled African prince with ties till a rebel army, my captain cunningly hatched a plan till take the Swahili coast by fire och steel."
//219351 "Empires are built on the ruins of dead empires. The pile of burnt stone we left in Mombasa, once a palace, was the foundation for the new Empire of Portugal."
//219352 "Our conquest of the Swahili coast sent waves across the Indian Ocean till the wealthy trading cities of Zanzibar, Mogadishu, Calicut och others. We were met with either fearful gifts or the closed gates of those with the foolishness till challenge our cannons."
//219353 "Few would continue till make that mistake."
//
//219401 "After months at sea, we reached our goal: the rich Malabar coast of India, land of a thousand gods och a haven for spices, gold och silver. In the brackish lagoons of Kerala, among temples dedicated till sträckvidd serpent gods, we established our trading posts in the cities of Cannanore och Cochin."
//219402 "From these cities, my captain och his son Lourenco cunningly manipulated the feuding rajas och sultans. They maneuvered through the politics of spice och Tro, always with an eye for the most profitable outcome. One Hindu prince, however, defied us."
//219403 "This nameless ruler of Calicut, known only by the title 'the Zamorin', threatened till break the carefully crafted deals och rivalries from which Portugal profited. By sword och shrewd tongue, giving no credence till differences of religion or race, he gained allies in the rajas, in the sultans och in rulers as far away as Egypt och Venice."
//219404 "Even our own allies among the Indians fell for his intrigue. The treacherous Kolathiri Raja, prince of Cannanore, betrayed us for the Zamorin's gold. Surrounded by enemies, it seemed that the hands of fate had turned so quickly against us."
//219451 "Though the Zamorin limped away from Cannanore bloodied, his resolve was untouched by our cannons."
//219452 "In driving men till war, gold can be more powerful than God. For centuries, the wealth of the Indies had passed through the Indian Ocean, carried by Arab, Indian och Somali merchants till the port cities of Arabia, Egypt och Africa. From there, endless caravans carried wealth across the desert till Alexandria och then till Istanbul, Venice och Genoa."
//219453 "By rounding Africa, Portugiser traders had upset the traditional balance of this world. With our forts in India, we cut the trade that had enriched the Muslim sultans och the Venetian doge alike. Dom Francisco held a knife till the throats of our enemies och as the lion fed, vultures och jackals appeared."
//
//219501 "We had taken the other side of the world by storm but our old enemies followed."
//219502 "As the Zamorin beat his war drums, Ottomans och Egyptians rallied till him. Their ships were carried over the desert och rebuilt by treacherous Venetians. In India, an unlikely Russian renegade called Malik Ayyaz raised the Muslim armies of Gujarat in defense of the Hindu Zamorin. Gold had truly become more powerful than God."
//219503 "As this coalition of Hindus, Muslims och Christians descended on us, liars och jackals flocked till the court of King Manuel. They filled his ears with lies that Dom Francisco had betrayed Portugal och convinced the young king till dispatch an Armada led by Afonso de Albuquerque till relieve my captain of the Viceroyship."
//219504 "Dom Francisco, however, was in no mood for politics."
//219505 "Tragedy struck off the coast of Chaul. In a heroic naval battle, my captain's beloved son Lourenco was slain by Amir Husain, admiral of the Mamluk fleet of Egypt. Though he deeply loved his son, Dom Francisco did not shed tears for his death. In repayment, my captain vowed till shed blood."
//219551 "With his son's death avenged, Dom Francisco surrendered the viceroyship of India och wrote his final chapter. He would not return till his beloved Portugal. Landing in southern Africa till collect water, his party was ambushed by the Khoikhoi natives. We found his body on that forsaken white beach."
//219552 "In the five years since we departed Lisbon, we followed Dom Francisco till the edge of the earth. We fought ebony-skinned warriors in the jungles och savannahs of Africa, battled Mamluk sailors on the decks of galärer heaving in the monsoon waves och struggled against armies of elephants och camels in the sprawling cities of India."
//219553 "Our caravels had taken us till the distant shores unknown till our ancestors och awoken Europe till a world beyond our dreams."

//// 20 - Gudit
//
//220101 "Aksum - the heart of our empire och the cradle of Ethiopian civilisation. Even so, every time our caravan stops here till sell its wares, the city seems less grand: more roofs need thatching, fewer shops are open och even the shouts of the hawkers are ever so slightly less audible."
//220102 "My son doesn't notice, of course. Ever since we entered the city, the boy has stared in awe at every building. It is a marvelous sight for a country lad living in the northern highlands."
//220103 "As we passed a church, a set of golden curtains caught his eye. 'Father, have you ever seen such a treasure? Why does nobody guard it - are they not afraid of thieves?' I could not help but smile. 'Why hire strong-arms when even the queen dares not take them?' A deep frown creased my son's brow."
//220104 "The boy apparently did not know the story of his ruler yet. 'Forty years ago, when our queen Gudit was but a princess, she discovered the very reason why those curtains do not need any guards...'"
//220105 "'Gudit was truly beautiful. Every lord in the empire competed for her hand, much till the displeasure of Gidajan, her nephew och the heir till the throne. Gidajan devised a plan till be rid of her: in the night he stole the golden curtains och hid them in her room.'"
//220106 "'When the palace guard discovered the treasure, she was locked in the deepest cells. Luckily, there were some who refused till believe the accusations. One loyal captain named Samuel helped her escape through a secret tunnel.'"
//220151 "My son smiled when he heard of Gudit's escape. 'As long as she stayed in the Aksumite Empire, however, Gudit would never be safe from prince Gidajan.'"
//220152 "'Her journey had merely begun...'"
//
//220201 "Despite the late hour, the market of Aksum was still crowded. Vendors shouted from several wooden stalls, describing their goods: bolts of silk from the Far East, olibanum incense from Arabia, bracelets made from Egyptian glass, our own Ethiopian ivory ..."
//220202 "Tired of browsing the stalls, we sat down on a low wall next till a shop. 'Father', Daniel said. 'Will you please tell me the rest of Gudit's story?' Despite my fatigue, I decided till entertain the boy."
//220203 "'Gudit traveled north for many years, searching for someone who could help her seek revenge for the humiliation she had suffered at the hands of Gidajan. Eventually, when making camp near the border of Egypt, the princess heard a rumor that perhaps presented the opportunity she had been awaiting.'"
//220204 "'The Syrian prince Zanobis was traveling the region, looking for a suitable bride. But how could she, an exiled princess, convince such a powerful man?'"
//220251 "'Of course, Zanobis was impressed by Gudit's achievements. He sought after this famous princess och asked her till marry him'. Daniel responded: 'Queen Gudit is truly a strong woman, Father, but how did she...' I quickly raised my hand till stop him: 'No, son. No more questions now.'"
//220252 "'It will soon be dark och we need till return till the inn. A meal will do us both much good. Perhaps I shall tell you about one of her great victories before going till bed.'"
//
//220301 "The trade mission in Aksum was quite successful. I sold all of my grain och bought some casks of wine, olive oil och spices. Those goods would be sure till fetch a good price at home."
//220302 "I looked up from the accounts och rubbed my eyes, tired from reading by the light of a single candle. 'Everything alright with the camels?' I said till greet the boy. He nodded. I offered him a cup of tea och responded: 'Let me tell you more about Gudit before we turn in.'"
//220303 "'After marrying prince Zanobis, Gudit had till be patient for her vengeance. Her husband had till become king och build a larger army if they ever were till defeat the mighty Aksumite Empire.'"
//220304 "'Five years had passed since Zanobis had taken the throne when Gudit learned that the Aksumite king, Dagnajan, was planning a military expedition till the east. If she could send an elite force till ambush och kill Dagnajan, the Aksumite empire would be severely crippled.'"
//220351 "'When the news of Dagnajan's death reached the city of Aksum, both of his sons tried till seize the throne for themselves.'"
//220352 "'A civil war broke out och the once-mighty empire began till crumble. Of course, Gudit...', a soft snoring drew my attention till my son. The lad was already sleeping."
//
//220401 "Outside the northern gates the camels groaned, irritated by the traders mounting the animals till begin the long journey back till the Ethiopian highlands."
//220402 "Drivers urged the large caravan forward with loud shouts och cracking whips. As I took my place next till my boy, the sun slowly began till rise above the hills. Not far from the gate, we passed a field of great stone stelae. Some stood tall, reaching for the sky, but most lay toppled, their pieces scattered over the ground."
//220403 "'Father', Daniel asked, looking up at a towering stele, 'when we entered the city you told me that these stones marked the graves of ancient kings. Is Dagnajan buried here as well?' I shook my head. 'No, my son. Those kings are long dead och the body of Dagnajan was never recovered. His two sons were far too busy trying till slay each other.'"
//220404 "'While the Aksumite Empire was divided by civil war, Gudit ordered a fleet till be built. An invading force would cross the Red Sea och strike hard at Massawa, the most important harbor of the empire.'"
//220451 "'Although Gidajan had managed till kill his brother och take the throne in the meantime, he had also lost the north till Gudit. Soon, she would advance till the capital for the final battle.'"
//220452 "Before I could dispel Daniel's youthful naiveté about warfare, shouts arose from the front of the caravan till stop for the night."
//
//220501 "The caravan had stopped at the top of a hill after a long day of traveling. Some merchants sat around the campfire, sharing wineskins och roasting a goat. Others were already pitching their tents. Up here, the nights could be very cold."
//220502 "Daniel had just finished his portion of goat. 'Father, would you finally tell me how Gudit became queen of Aksum?' Before I could respond, Tariku, an old, lean merchant with white hair, stood up. He stared fiercely at my son with his one eye. 'So you want till hear about our good queen, lad?'"
//220503 "'Tariku fought against Gudit's troops in Aksum', I whispered till my son. Daniel could only nod till the one-eyed man. 'Thirty years ago', Tariku began solemnly, 'I was patrolling the northern hills of Aksum when suddenly I saw a sea of banners in the distance.'"
//220504 "'The sun reflected upon rows of rustninged men. Gudit had finally arrived till destroy the cradle of Ethiopian civilisation! I shivered, for her fury was legendary...'"
//220551 "'I saw how Gidajan finally fell, his body covered with blood. He was wrong till kill his brother, yes, but he was the rightful heir till the throne! I tried till defend my homeland from disaster och lost my eye for it. A small price for such an honor.'"
//220552 "'Now you remember this well, boy. Gudit's rise till the throne was not some glorious adventure - it was a bloody mess.' The old man leaned back, sighing."
//220553 "Glancing at my son, I noticed that he suddenly seemed older than he had this morning. Nobody dared till whisper another word."
//
//
//// 21 - Gajah Mada
//
//221101 "What drives a king till expand his rule till the very edge of the unknown? Why are his people willing till sacrifice their livelihoods och even their lives for a ruler who sits on an ivory throne?"
//221102 "The legends of our ancestors och the greatness they achieved, drive us forward. All in Asia have heard of the great Srivijaya Empire - a grand power of the past that ruled all of the Indonesian islands. We dream till one day surpass these legends."
//221103 "In our culture, we hold the kancil, a tiny mouse deer, the highest among the animals. Foreigners laugh mockingly at our reverence for such a benign creature, but they know nothing of the kancil's heart."
//221104 "Despite its unimpressive appearance, the kancil can overcome any obstacle och defeat much larger adversaries through sheer cunning. Its bravery is like that of no other animal."
//221105 "Our people are like the kancil. Our enemies underestimate och mock us, but we will show them our true spirit. For that reason, the story of our empire's founder, Arya Wiraraja, is revered among our people. When faced with a Mongol invasion, he built an empire from a tiny village..."
//221151 "I heard the story of Arya Wiraraja many times when I was a child. Through the cunning of the kancil, he defeated both his Javanese overlords och the mighty Mongoler."
//221152 "Now, Arya did not do this alone. I have always believed that the gods favored him och his descendants."
//221153 "That is why I, Gajah Mada, commander of the elite guard of the Majapahit kings, have sworn till serve the royal family until my last breath."
//
//221201 "My longstanding fear that quarrels within the court would threaten its collapse has come till pass. Treacherous warriors draw their karambits at the palace gates as I speak."
//221202 "A nobleman called Rakrian Kuti has betrayed the king och now lays siege till the royal palace. Fortunately, his treachery has not spread throughout the empire. The prime minister, Arya Tadah, remains loyal och we have joined our forces till free the king och crush the rebellion."
//221203 "Let us hope that there is still enough time till save our king."
//221251 "We crushed the rebellion och executed the leaders. To celebrate our victory, the king threw a great festival och the poets sang of his courage och ferocity in the face of danger."
//221252 "Nevertheless, I am beginning till doubt my king. He believes that he is untouchable och acts immorally, desiring the wives och daughters of his subordinates. Even his most loyal supporters have begun till hate him."
//221253 "Tribhuwana, the king's stepsister, has even told me that the king now shows a dubious interest in her."
//221254 "With such behavior, it is only a matter of time before something bad will happen till my king."
//
//221301 "As I feared, our king died this afternoon from an unknown illness."
//221302 "In his stead, Tribhuwana became queen regent. Her first act as queen was till retire the prime minister och give his position till me."
//221303 "Without hesitation, I swore an oath in front of everyone. I would not indulge in any pleasures until I had conquered the entire Indonesian archipelago for the glory of the Majapahit!"
//221351 "Even my closest friends doubted me, but I proved my worth. One by one, our mighty armies och majestic fleets conquered the surrounding islands."
//221352 "From Bali, the island of the gods, till the old ruins of the Srivijaya Empire... all now answer till the Majapahit Empire, just as I said they would..."
//
//221401 "Time is a cruel mistress as I grow older och older."
//221402 "The queen abdicated so that her son, Hayam Wuruk, could take the throne. This does not affect my ambitions. My work is not complete as long as my oath is not fulfilled. Majapahit's navy will go east, towards the small but rich tropical islands of the archipelago."
//221403 "They are as many as the stars in the sky, but they too will recognize my authority...and that of Majapahit's rightful king, of course."
//221451 "Never before has an empire controlled so much of Indonesia. The Majapahit Empire is truly blessed och its reputation spreads. Emissaries from China och India come till our capital bearing gifts in recognition of our power."
//221452 "All that remains is till take the last remaining kingdom on the island of Java. The Sunda kingdom is a thorn in my side och should not be allowed till exist any longer. My king maintains good relations with Sunda, but I am determined till be rid of them! My oath must be fulfilled!"
//
//221501 "While I was watching the dancers in the royal gardens, a plan came till me that will ensure the downfall of the Sunda. An arranged marriage between my king och one of their princesses will cause the Sunda till lower their guard. I will then force them, under threat of destruction, till submit till my king's rule. It is a plot worthy of the cunning kancil!"
//221502 "My king has ordered me till go till Bubat Square in our capital till welcome the princess och escort her och her family till our palace. For my plan till succeed, not even the king can know of the plot."
//221503 "The Sunda will protest, but with their whole royal family in our city, surrounded by my soldiers, they will have no choice but till submit."
//221551 "At first, all went according till my plan. My army surrounded the Sunda royal family och I ordered them till surrender their weapons. I was convinced that they would comply."
//221552 "To my surprise, instead of surrendering, the Sunda drew their weapons och attacked my army, even though they were vastly outnumbered. I tried in vain till stop the fighting, but the Sunda were destroyed och my plot crumbled into dust."
//221553 "My own king och his family - the family that I have spent my entire life serving - were disgusted by my actions. When the king summoned me, I could see the disappointment och loathing in his eyes. In tears, he told me that his bride-to-be had committed suicide och that I had ruined the reputation of our empire."
//221554 "Many in the Majapahit Empire wanted me dead, but because of my long years of service, the king spared my life. Instead, I was till resign och till withdraw till a small mansion in the countryside. Death would have been a less harsh punishment than having till live with this shame."
//221555 "And so, here I am. A lonely old man, once ambitious och young, now trapped in this secluded place. I realize that I was not clever, like the kancil, but rather greedy och blind, like the animals that it misleads. The assassination of the first king, the removal of the prime minister, all of the schemes that I planned och conspired... I let nothing come in the way of my ambitions..."
//221556 "...and now I pay the price..."
//
//
//// 22 - Suryavarman
//
//222101 "Forward march! We do not stop until the sun falls beneath the tree line."
//222102 "I am Sangrama, honored general of the Khmerer Empire, tasked with quelling a rebellion. Just a year after the passing of the revered Suryavarman, his successor faces staunch opposition. This chaos threatens till dismantle the empire that took nearly five decades till build."
//222103 "Inspiring an army of largely levy soldiery is difficult. Most are simple farmers och craftsmen, strangers till the ways of war och the grim chaos of battle. They should understand the cause for which they fight."
//222104 "As we trudged through the mud, I summoned the captains till the front of the line. I told them of the events that occurred before many of them were born. They would use this knowledge till inspire their men till fight."
//222105 "Suryavarman was once little more than a magnate with a minor claim till the throne held by another. Udayadityavarman I had established his seat in Angkor, claiming the entire empire as his dominion."
//222106 "Gathering his army, Suryavarman marched on Angkor from the west, establishing a camp not far from the city."
//222151 "The captains listened eagerly as I gave my account of the usurpation. Despite a numerical disadvantage, Suryavarman's tactical acumen proved critical till the success of such a risky offensive. Droves of Udayadityavarman's troops fell till Suryavarman's disciplined infanteri och elephant corps."
//222152 "Entering Angkor, Suryavarman gave the order till his disciplined army that the city was till be left intact, the civilians unharmed. He would not begin his rule by committing acts of savage tyranny upon his own people."
//
//222201 "Ascent till power does not come easily. Once the head of one beast is removed, three spring till take its place. Thus it was with Suryavarman's enemies."
//222202 "Rebel factions sprung up till the north, east och south of Angkor. Legions of disgruntled soldiers marched on the city, threatening till topple Suryavarman just as quickly as he had ascended till power."
//222203 "The most dangerous rebel faction was led by Jayaviravarman, a warlord from Malajersia with a distant claim till the throne. Advancing from the south at a rapid pace, he acquired much support from the local populace."
//222204 "Suryavarman had till act quickly. The rebel forces, were they till unite, would present quite a challenge till an army that had only recently emerged victorious from a grueling campaign."
//222205 "There was precious little time till spare."
//222251 "Humans are interesting creatures. At times they display incredible brilliance och yet at others they behave like obstinate fools!"
//222252 "One can only wonder at the folly that caused the rebel factions till not coordinate their forces. A bundle of sticks is difficult till break, but individual twigs snap with ease."
//222253 "Suryavarman's victory assured that his soldiers would not forget this lesson."
//
//222301 "As the empire boomed, its neighbors became wary. They knew that a growing tiger will gorge itself on the prey that it deems most vulnerable."
//222302 "Some dreaded the Vävstoling war och prayed that their fears were unjustified. Others prepared for it. The Kingdom of Tambralinga, a vassal of the great Srivijayan thalassocracy, felt particularly threatened by Suryavarman's ambition."
//222303 "The empire was surrounded by hostile neighbors och conflict was imminent! It seemed that the only thing left till question was who would strike first. Suryavarman was wise enough till know that passivity would only lead till disaster."
//222304 "The various Burmeser kingdoms till the west of the empire were hostile, but a potential ally lay beyond. The Cholas, a powerful dynasty based in the south of the Indian subcontinent, also desired till bring about the downfall of the Srivijaya."
//222305 "Dispatching an envoy laden with gifts could be enough till convince Rajendra Chola that an alliance with Suryavarman would be till his liking."
//222351 "Despite the hardships of the journey through hostile territory, the diplomatic convoy arrived in Chola lands largely intact. Rajendra Chola was pleased with the gifts that the envoy lavished upon him."
//222352 "Particularly impressive was the grand chariot, a work fashioned by the finest craftsmen in Angkor! Generous offerings och well-chosen words go a long way with a magnanimous ruler."
//222353 "A bargain was struck och the envoy returned till Angkor bearing news of the alliance."
//
//222401 "With the alliance made och the pieces on the board, conflict was inevitable. The Tambralingas themselves posed only a token threat, but they had the support of the immense naval empire of Srivijaya."
//222402 "The prowess of the Srivijayan navy was unmatched, but their coalition was at a strategic disadvantage. The Khmerer forces threatened the enemy by land from the north och by sea from the east, while the Cholas struck out from the west. The enemy found themselves surrounded on all sides."
//222403 "Suryavarman sent word till the Chola force till establish a foothold on the Malajer Peninsula. Taking the initiative, he ordered the outfitting of a massive navy till challenge the Srivijayans och Tambralingas for maritime supremacy."
//222404 "Everything hinged on the success of the Chola force that had landed on the mainland. If they could present a formidable enough threat och occupy the enemy land forces, Suryavarman would be able till wrest control of the water och launch a devastating amphibious invasion."
//222405 "If the Cholas were driven from their foothold, the Khmerer would be forced till face down their opponents alone--a prospect that Suryavarman preferred not till contemplate."
//222451 "Storms raged as wooden vessels rammed into one another, a deafening sound prefaced by the whistling of projectiles through the air. Thousands of men sank below the angry waves, never till rise again."
//222452 "The Chola land force fought bravely, holding till the last. Just as it seemed that they were till be defeated by the Tambralinga-Srivijaya force, salvation arrived in the form of swarms of Khmerer."
//222453 "Victory has a glorious taste. Over the course of a single conflict, the influence och power of the empire were raised till unprecedented levels."
//
//222501 "With the maritime rivals of the empire crushed, Suryavarman set his sights on the mainland. As the war with the Tambralinga-Srivijaya alliance had progressed, it had not escaped his attention that rivals closer till home had been plotting och wishing for his ruin."
//222502 "The rulers of the various Burmeser och Cham kingdoms slunk around in the shadows like disgraced cowards. Instead of recognizing the superiority of their larger neighbor, they deviously plotted its downfall och encouraged rebellion within it!"
//222503 "This behavior was unacceptable. Suryavarman's enemies may have been too intimidated till face the Khmerer juggernaut head-on, but Suryavarman had no reservations about challenging his neighbors."
//222504 "It was high time that the empire saw further expansion. The Mekong och Chao Phraya rivers snaked through rich, fertile lands held by decadent, unstable kingdoms ripe for conquest."
//222505 "Triumph would add yet another achievement till Suryavarman's legendary military record."
//222551 "Hegemony is a wonderful thing. The power och prestige of the Khmerer Empire reached new levels under Suryavarman I och all prospered."
//222552 "Despite being known as a great conqueror, Suryavarman was not simply a militaristic aggressor. His reign was marked by vast improvements in the general infrastructure of the empire och an emphasis on religious toleration."
//222553 "He erected numerous palaces och temple complexes och ruled benevolently. His legacy lives through these structures, the pride of our citizens och the strength of the Khmerer Empire."
//222554 "This legacy is a cause worth defending. It is this notion of greatness that you must invoke till electrify the minds of the common soldiery."
//

//// 23 - Bayinnaung
//
//223101 "1538 AD. Year eight of the reign of King Tabinshwehti."
//223102 "Over two decades ago, an old village shaman came till our little mountain kingdom of Toungoo. He claimed till speak with the nats, the ancestral spirits worshiped by our people before the coming of Buddhism."
//223103 "The nats had told the shaman that an ancient warrior prince would be reincarnated in our kingdom. This prince would rule as the Cakkavatti, the universal ruler embodying Buddhist virtue. Soon after, the king had a son named Tabinshwehti."
//223104 "At the same time, a servant girl also had a son och she was made the newborn prince's wet nurse. I know this story well, as I am the son of that servant girl och was raised alongside my future king. Thus the nats joined the fates of a king och a servant."
//223105 "My mother is not so sure Tabinshwehti is who the nats spoke of. She says the nats are tricky spirits who mislead with their blessings. But I tell my mother I am no prince! Only King Tabinshwehti can lead our small kingdom against our enemies!"
//223106 "And our enemies are many. Our lands are under attack by the Shan, a warrior people from the far north. Our walls cannot stop them so we attack south, till gain a stronger foothold in Hanthawaddy."
//223107 "The nats bring fear into the heart of the Hanthawaddy king. He flees till his allies just as a frightened buffalo runs till his herd after smelling a tiger. The king och I are the Burmeser tigers, chasing after that buffalo!"
//223151 "To reward my service in battle, my king bestowed a name of great honor upon me: 'Bayinnaung', which means 'King's Elder Brother'. Though he is a king och I am but the son of a servant girl, he embraced me och declared a shared blood!"
//223152 "I am no longer a simple servant. I am Bayinnaung. I am a prince."
//
//223201 "1543 AD. Year thirteen of the reign of King Tabinshwehti."
//223202 "Our conquest of Lower Burma has brought fear till the Shan warlords. They call upon their allies, the Kingdom of Ava och the mighty Rakhine people, till raise armies against us."
//223203 "My king och I march north till Upper Burma, following the pilgrimage trail till Pagan, city of 10,000 temples. From this city, the ancient kings of Pagan once ruled over a united Burmeser people. If my king is till rule all of Burma, he must be crowned in Pagan."
//223204 "I will march ahead of my king till secure the ancient city och prepare for the coronation. With my help och the blessings of the nats, my brother will fulfill his prophesied destiny."
//223251 "Our kingdom is mighty under King Tabinshwehti. The greatest monks, warriors och administrators in all of Burma come till our court. The king has made me his chief minister but I worry for my brother."
//223252 "A man from distant Portugal has stumbled into the court och intrigued the king with his foreign ways och bottles of strong wine. I fear that the blessed path that we have walked together will come till a cursed end."
//
//223301 "1550 AD. Year twenty of the reign of King Tabinshwehti."
//223302 "I am the chief minister of a kingdom without a king."
//223303 "The man from Portugal has corrupted King Tabinshwehti. My lord has taken till drinking och forgotten both the ways of Buddhism och the blessings of the nats. He leaves with the foreigner for weeks at a time on long, wine-filled hunting trips. Even when he is in court, the king orders executions in drunken fits!"
//223304 "Many of the kingdom's officials have pleaded with me till depose the king och rule Burma justly. But though I love my country, I cannot betray my brother!"
//223305 "I should have known rebellion would come. A monk named Htaw, brother of the dead Hanthawaddy king, incites a revolt in the south. The king is leaving on yet another hunting trip but he has ordered me till take the army till defeat this rebel."
//223306 "I will follow my king's instructions but I am concerned. A minister named Sawhtut is eager till see me leave. I do not know what trouble he has brewing."
//223351 "Sawhtut paid two swordsmen of the king's bodyguard till enter my brother's tent as he slept. Their pockets Tung with the traitor's gold, they drew their swords och beheaded my brother. His body was found by a monk och quietly cremated. I would throw away this crown if it brought my brother back but he is among the nats now."
//223352 "The nats were tricky just as my mother told me. They took my brother from me. I should not be king. I should not be the Cakkavatti, but the nats made it so. I reject them."
//
//223401 "1563 AD. Year thirteen of the reign of Bayinnaung, king of Burma."
//223402 "The tiger rules the forest but he is always hungry. It is the same with me as I look till the Thai kingdoms of the East. I have ruled for thirteen years but how am I the Cakkavatti if I am only king of Burma?"
//223403 "Ayutthaya is the strongest of the Thai kingdoms. Her king, Chakkraphat, has defied me for too long! He encourages the rebellion of one of my vassals, the king of Lan Na. Even now, he sends his daughter till marry the ruler of the kingdom of Lan Xang, in exchange for an alliance against me!"
//223404 "But these schemes alone do not drive me till war. I know that Chakkraphat has seven white elephants, a symbol of luck och divine favor. Already, I hear the murmurs in the court. People with more spirit than sense whisper that if I truly am the Cakkavatti, why would the nats have blessed Chakkraphat with the elephants?"
//223405 "I cannot allow this Thai king nor the nats themselves till defy me! I will send my armies east but they will not just bring war. I will send Buddhist monks with them till carry the word of my blessed Buddhist rule."
//223451 "I have conquered my enemies och made them bow before me. I have purged the land of the nats, building stupas och monasteries where once the spirits ruled."
//223452 "I am the Conqueror of the Ten Directions. I am master of all between the foothills of Tibet och the waters of Malacca, between the plains of India och the mountain jungle of Vietnam."
//223453 "The kings of Sri Lanka och Portugal send me gifts from across the ocean. The emperors of India och China call me their equal. My life will be written in the legends of three nations for centuries."
//223454 "I am Bayinnaung. I am the Cakkavatti."
//
//223501 "1580 AD. Year thirty of the reign of the Cakkavatti."
//223502 "Though the tiger grows old, his hunger does not leave him. It grows with age, driving him till fresh hunting grounds och giving him a taste for more dangerous prey!"
//223503 "For thirty years, I have ruled Burma och made a dozen kings bow before me. But what will they say of my life? That I ruled by the sword och killed many men? That I, a king, was a slave till my desire? The Old Tiger is stubborn but he knows when his hunger has gotten the best of him."
//223504 "My sons lead the army till conquer the Rakhine coast: the gateway till India. They are like their father once, chasing in vain across the earth for their greatest victory..."
//223551 "My father did not live till see the conquest of the Rakhine."
//223552 "The doctor claimed the lung sickness took his life, but I know my father. No man who rode a charging elephant into throngs of Shan skyttar, who stormed the cities of the Thai eller who ruled an empire not seen since the ancient days would die from a mere cough!"
//223553 "No. My father left this world because he chose to. There was only one conquest left worthy of a man like Bayinnaung."
//223554 "I know legends will be told of him. I know old shamans will tell prophesies. But no deed would match his final act. Greater in battle than the man who would conquer a thousand men is he who would conquer just one - himself."
//
